par.text: Rutherfordium is a synthetic, radioactive metal. It was first produced in 1964 by the Russian researchers directed by G.N. Flerov, by the bombardment of plutonium-242 with neon-22 ions. In 1969 the American team of researchers led by Albert Ghiorso reported a successful preparation of this element. They obtained it by bombarding californiium-239 with a mixture of carbon-12 and carbon-13 ions. The most stable rutherfordium isotope is
Rf, whose half-life is found to be 65 seconds. The element was named in honour of the physicist Ernest Rutherford.
